content: @John Moehrke asked about this during the FMG session in Q4 today. Here's a Jira filter that shows issues for FHIR Core that aren't assigned to a workgroup.
looking at them... FHIR-I is not going to be happy
I (think) I made it viewable by the public, and I made the hl7-trusted-users, John, and @Lloyd McKenzie editors for it.
@Michael Donnelly this filter includes items that have been retracted.
Ah, retraction. Forgot about that as a possibility. Those might indeed not have WGs
I moved one to CBCP, and 3 to security.... doing my part.
What's an example of one that's retracted (so I can test that an update to the filter excludes it)?

I've updated. The possibly relevant statuses are 'submitted' or 'waiting-for-input". (Other possible statuses that can exist without a WG are 'duplicate' and 'Resolved-no-change', where the latter will have a resolution of "retracted".)
Excellent - that means setting it so other people could edit the filter worked, too. :)
not necessarily. Lloyd is Jira god, he can't be stopped by anything.
